alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 6:17AM CDT until June 10 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and west central Arkansas, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Crawford. In west central Arkansas, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 616 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ozark... Mountainburg... Mulberry... Altus... Denning... Chester... Wiederkehr Village... Fern... Cass... Lake Fort Smith... Lonelm... Cravens... Toney... Jethro... Watalula... Paradise... Piney... Cecil... Barnes... Turners Bend... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
